doc.content: (Los Angeles) A package of beef and a letter from "Animal Justice League" claiming that meat had been poisoned in 20 Los Angeles supermarkets was left at the Los Angeles Times, 1st Street offices. The paper also received a phone call taking credit for the action and stating, "We will take direct action againsts animal abuse in whatever form is necessary to stop the cruelty." A similar threat was made against a supermarket in Upsala in November. No poisoned meat was found at either supermarket.
